newsitem.title: FRANCE: Renault, PSA to cut jobs -paper.
newsitem.headline: Renault, PSA to cut jobs -paper.

text.p: French car companies Renault SA and PSA Peugeot Citroen are seeking approval from the government to cut up to 26,000 jobs in the coming years, financial daily Les Echos reported on Wednesday.
An official at Renault confirmed that the carmakers were in talks with the government but did not comment on the number of job cuts.
The paper said the cuts, which would be achieved through attrition and early retirements, would come about through the suppression of 40,000 posts and the hiring of 14,000 younger replacements.
The government was wary of the move which some estimates indicated could cost up to 30 billion francs, the paper said.
Les Echos said the French carmakers were spurred to accelerate their restructuring by continued loss of their domestic market share and by a desire to lower the average age of their workforces.
The companies were also trying to achieve their restructuring ahead of the total liberalisation of the European car market.
